subject: FROM US Department of Justice
body:
FROM US Department of Justice
Foreign Claims Settlement Commission (FCSC)
441 G Street, NW., Room 6330
Washington, D.C. 20579
United States of America
Contact me at this official email : 
commissionerfcscrep@gmail.com
Attention Beneficiary,
Following series of investigations of some blocked Foreign and local
Claims, we came across your file and found out that you have not yet
received your compensation payment of Five Millions Five Hundred
Thousand United States Dollars (US$5,500,000.00), Therefore Foreign
Claims Settlement Commission of the United States (FCSC) in its
foreign settlement agreements have found your compensation claim
reasonable enough to be released, which has led us to contact you
through this medium as one of the Beneficiaries that is due for these
claim.
The Department of the Treasury's role is to ensure that the claimants
receive the proper payment amount as authorized in the public law of
the Foreign Claims Program. Your payment has been authorized and your
total funds will be delivered to you in cash through diplomat means,
Your documents has been verified and all your clearance certificate is
still valid, therefore your funds will be delivered to your home
address in cash in a consignment trunk once we have received
confirmation from you that you are still alive, also
 you will need to
pay only $250 USD as the shipping cost of this delivery
.
Yours Faithfully,
Mr. Patrick Hovakimian
Commissioner,
Foreign Claims Settlement Commission (FCSC)
Contact me at this official email : 
commissionerfcscrep@gmail.com

subject: Re: FROM US Department of Justice
body:
Dear Mr. Patrick Hovakimian,

Thank you for your email and the information provided. I am indeed alive and interested in receiving the funds that are due to me.

However, before proceeding further, I would like to clarify a few things:

1. Could you please provide more details about the origin of these funds? How did my name come up in relation to this claim?

2. You mentioned a payment of USD for shipping costs. Could you please provide more details on how this payment should be made?

3. Can you confirm that there will be no additional fees or charges after this payment is made?

4. Lastly, could you please provide some form of identification or proof that this communication is indeed from the Foreign Claims Settlement Commission (FCSC)?

I look forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Luella
